newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' April money levels kept below ceiling.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' April money levels kept below ceiling.

text.p: The Philippines has kept April monetary levels below the ceiling set by the International Monetary Fund, the Central Bank said on Sunday.
"Latest Central Bank preliminary data on operating ceilings of base money and reserve money showed an overperformance of about 15 billion pesos in April," the bank said in a statement.
Year-on-year growth rates for both indicators have been kept at 10 percent, it said.
The bank said the slow growth in money supply was achieved through higher overnight and termed borrowing rates.

Base money includes money in circulation, reserve balances and government securities deposited with the Central Bank. Reserve money is base money minus government securities deposited with the Central Bank.

"With these positive developments in the leading indicators of inflation, along with favourable performance of agriculture and steady trend in petroleum prices, the Central Bank governor is confident that the price movements will remain broadly on track," the statement added.
The Philippines is scheduled to release the April inflation rate on Monday. -- MANILA NEWSROOM (63 2) 8418938 Fax 8176267
